head.title: Welcome to Wenatchee Public Schools! | Wenatchee

a.title: OSPI Report Card (opens in new window)

li.a: Castle Rock Early Childhood Learning Center

a.title: Contact - School Board - Main Menu link

div.p: In the Wenatchee School District we're committed to ensuring all of our students are seen, valued, feel safe and know they belong.

div.a: Learn about our strategic plan and promise

div.p: To emphasize the importance of traffic safety in school zones, the Wenatchee School District is partnering with the Wenatchee Police Department's traffic unit to conduct emphasis patrols during the first few weeks of the school year.

Discover a variety of community youth sports and activity opportunities for kids in grades K-8 at this fun, festive, and family-friendly event. Get excited for Fall athletics and activities, and find out how your child can get in the game! Sports and activity booths * Music * Food Trucks * WHS Athletes and Coaches * Panther Merchandise * CVCH Physicals * Family Financial Assistance Info

Students in grades 2-12 are invited to audition for a tasty treat of a show! Roald Dahl's Charlie and the Chocolate Factory is based on the famous novel of the same name. Auditions take place September 9th - 13th after school in the WHS Auditorium.

div.a: Get grade level audition dates and info

div.p: Wenatchee School District’s students, teachers, and staff reflect the diversity and richness of Wenatchee. Through high-quality instruction, social-emotional support, and career-connected learning, we are helping each and every student achieve success and tap into their limitless potential.

div.style: background-image: url('/files/Theme/theme%20files/stats-bg.jpg'); background-size: cover; background-repeat: no-repeat; background-position: center center;

div.p: Students come to our schools with different lived experiences, starting points, and needs. We believe every student has limitless potential and deserves an education that will help them reach their academic and career goals—whatever they may be. That’s why we’re working hard to make WSD a place everyone knows they belong and has what they need to succeed.

div.class: csw cs-icon-wrap cs-icon-xxl cs-icon-center cs-icon-default cs-icon-bg-default cs-icon-text-default

div.p: Exceptional educators, including full- and part-time certified and classified employees, who take pride in serving our students and community

div.class: csw cs-icon-wrap cs-icon-xxl cs-icon-center cs-icon-default cs-icon-bg-default cs-icon-text-default

div.p: Students who are 53 percent LatinX, 43 percent white, and 4 percent from other cultural and racial backgrounds.

div.class: csw cs-icon-wrap cs-icon-xxl cs-icon-center cs-icon-default cs-icon-bg-default cs-icon-text-default

div.p: One early childhood learning center, seven elementary schools, three middle schools, one comprehensive high school, one alternative high school, a K-8 alternative parent partnership school, a technical skills center and a 18-21 transitions program.

div.class: csw cs-icon-wrap cs-icon-xxl cs-icon-center cs-icon-default cs-icon-bg-default cs-icon-text-default

div.p: Six big learning outcomes for students to fulfill their potential, and graduate—ready to pursue vocational training, college, or a career.
